people.title: People
people.description: List of all individuals participating in or related to the innovation program.

opportunities.title: Opportunities
opportunities.description: All identified innovation opportunities before any go/no-go screening.

initiatives.title: Initiatives
initiatives.description: All innovation initiatives/projects that stem from prioritized opportunities.

programConfiguration.title: Program Configuration
programConfiguration.description: High‐level settings, governance, and scope for the entire innovation program. Defines boundaries, objectives, funding, and key indicators.

programName.title: Program Name
programName.description: The official name used to brand and identify the innovation program.

programObjectives.title: Program Objectives
programObjectives.description: Strategic goals the innovation program aims to achieve, aligned with overall corporate strategy. Must be SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound).

programScope.title: Program Scope
programScope.description: Clear boundaries and focus areas for the innovation program—what is in scope and what is out of scope. Guides team efforts and resource allocation.

programIndicators.title: Program Indicators
programIndicators.description: Key performance indicators (KPIs) used to quantify success and progress (e.g., number of opportunities generated, time to prototype, ROI).

programGovernance.title: Program Governance
programGovernance.description: Defines decision-making processes, stage‐gate roles (e.g., Innovation Sponsor, Innovation Manager), and meeting cadences for program oversight.

programFunding.title: Program Funding
programFunding.description: Describes sources of funding, budget allocation rules, and financial oversight for all initiatives under this program.

programStages.title: Program Stages
programStages.description: Ordered list of phases that any initiative must pass through (e.g., Idea Definition → Concept Design → Prototype → Validation → Pilot → Launch). Acts as the standard Stage-Gate process.

programReporting.title: Program Reporting
programReporting.description: Describes frequency (e.g., monthly, quarterly) and format (dashboards, slide decks) for reporting progress to stakeholders and steering committees.

programDefaultOpportunityStatuses.title: Default Opportunity Statuses
programDefaultOpportunityStatuses.description: Predefined labels for tracking opportunity states in the funnel (e.g., Identified, Under Review, Prioritized, Archived).

programDefaultInitiativeTypes.title: Default Initiative Types
programDefaultInitiativeTypes.description: Standard categories to classify each initiative (e.g., New Product Development, Process Improvement). Facilitates resource allocation and portfolio analysis.

person.title: Person
person.description: Defines an individual who participates in or contributes to the innovation program. Associates roles, profiles, and contact details.

personId.title: Person ID
personId.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for each individual. Used for cross‐referencing throughout the system.

personName.title: Person Name
personName.description: Full legal name or commonly used name of the individual.

personDescription.title: Person Role / Short Bio
personDescription.description: Brief summary of the person’s role, department, expertise, or biography relevant to the innovation program.

personRole.title: Person Role
personRole.description: Defines the individual’s role in the innovation context (e.g., Innovation Manager, Sponsor, Team Member).

personUrl.title: Person Profile URL
personUrl.description: Optional link to an external profile (LinkedIn, internal directory) or detailed bio page.

personImageUrl.title: Person Image URL
personImageUrl.description: Optional link to a profile picture or avatar for visual identification in the application.

opportunity.title: Opportunity
opportunity.description: Represents a potential innovation opportunity, framed as a problem or unmet need. Follows Design Thinking and Jobs‐to‐be‐Done practices.

opportunityId.title: Opportunity ID
opportunityId.description: Unique identifier for this opportunity, used to track it throughout the funnel.

opportunityName.title: Opportunity Name
opportunityName.description: Concise name or headline for the opportunity (e.g., 'Reduce Customer Support Wait Time').

opportunityDescription.title: Opportunity Description
opportunityDescription.description: Detailed contextual description, background, or narrative around why this opportunity matters. Captures qualitative details that don’t fit in other fields.

opportunityProblem.title: Opportunity Problem
opportunityProblem.description: A clear problem statement or unmet need, phrased either as a 'How Might We...' (Design Thinking) or a 'Job-to-be-Done' format (e.g., 'When X happens, I want to Y so that Z'). This is the core of the Define phase.

opportunitySource.title: Opportunity Source
opportunitySource.description: Where this opportunity was identified (e.g., Customer Feedback, Market Trend, Internal Brainstorm, Competitor Analysis).

opportunityStakeholders.title: Opportunity Stakeholders
opportunityStakeholders.description: Key people or groups affected by or involved with this opportunity. Helps to identify who should be consulted or informed (Design Thinking – Empathize broader audience).

opportunityProposerId.title: Opportunity Proposer ID
opportunityProposerId.description: ID of the person who identified or proposed this opportunity. Links back to a personId in the People array.

opportunityPriority.title: Opportunity Priority
opportunityPriority.description: Numerical priority score (0–10) that indicates the relative importance or urgency. Scoring could be based on factors such as strategic alignment and ROI potential.

opportunityStatus.title: Opportunity Status
opportunityStatus.description: Current funnel state for this opportunity (e.g., Identified, Under Review, Prioritized, Archived).

opportunityDateIdentified.title: Date Identified
opportunityDateIdentified.description: Date when this opportunity was first entered into the system. Supports measuring funnel cycle time.

opportunityLastUpdated.title: Last Updated
opportunityLastUpdated.description: Automatically managed timestamp for when any property of this opportunity was last modified. Read-only.

initiative.title: Initiative
initiative.description: An innovation project or experiment that addresses a prioritized opportunity. Follows Lean Startup cycles and Stage-Gate reviews.

initiativeId.title: Initiative ID
initiativeId.description: Unique identifier for this initiative, used to track it across all phases and experiments.

initiativeName.title: Initiative Name
initiativeName.description: Short, descriptive name for the initiative (e.g., 'Automated Support Chatbot MVP').

initiativeType.title: Initiative Type
initiativeType.description: Category of the initiative, e.g., New Product Development, Process Improvement, Technology Exploration. Used for portfolio analysis.

initiativePhase.title: Initiative Phase
initiativePhase.description: Current stage of this initiative in the programStages sequence (e.g., Idea Definition, Concept Design, Prototype Development, Validation, Pilot Testing, Launched, Scaling, On Hold, Cancelled).

initiativeManagerId.title: Initiative Manager ID
initiativeManagerId.description: ID of the person responsible for leading this initiative. Must match a personId in People.

initiativeOpportunityId.title: Linked Opportunity ID
initiativeOpportunityId.description: ID of the opportunity that this initiative addresses. Provides direct traceability from project → opportunity → problem.

initiativeTargetUser.title: Initiative Target User
initiativeTargetUser.description: Name or descriptor of the user/customer segment that this initiative aims to serve. Aligns with Design Thinking’s user focus.

initiativeProblem.title: Initiative Problem Statement
initiativeProblem.description: Precise problem or unmet need that the initiative aims to solve. Should align with the opportunity’s problem and be phrased as a hypothesis or job‐to‐be‐done statement.

initiativeSolution.title: Initiative Solution Description
initiativeSolution.description: High‐level overview of the solution concept: what will be built, prototyped, or delivered. Focus on user value and core functionality for initial testing.

initiativeValueProposition.title: Initiative Value Proposition
initiativeValueProposition.description: Statement of unique value or benefits that this solution will deliver to the target user. Serves as a north star to validate effectiveness.

initiativeSolutionHypothesis.title: Solution Hypothesis
initiativeSolutionHypothesis.description: The core assumption(s) about how the proposed solution will solve the problem and produce value. Guides experiment design (Lean Startup: Build-Measure-Learn).

initiativeGoals.title: Goals / Success Metrics
initiativeGoals.description: List of specific, measurable outcomes (KPIs) you expect: e.g., user engagement rate, conversion %, time to first value. These feed into the Measure step.
initiativeGoals.nn-source: OKR Methodology; Lean Startup Metrics Framework

initiativeObjective.title: Experiment Objective
initiativeObjective.description: What exactly are you testing with this experiment? This should be a testable statement (e.g., “Users will prefer feature X over existing process Y at least 60% of the time”).

initiativeResults.title: Experiment Results
initiativeResults.description: Observations, quantitative data, and qualitative feedback from the experiment/MVP. Summarize what happened during testing.

initiativeLearnings.title: Key Learnings
initiativeLearnings.description: Synthesized insights from experiment results. What did you learn about the problem, user behavior, or solution viability? This informs the Learn step.

initiativeDecision.title: Decision (Go/No-Go)
initiativeDecision.description: After evaluating results and learnings, select whether to Persevere (continue iterating), Pivot (change fundamental approach), Discard (stop), or Validate for Handover (move to next Stage-Gate).

initiativeDecisionJustification.title: Decision Justification
initiativeDecisionJustification.description: Rationale behind the Go/No-Go decision. Should reference experiment results, learnings, or market feedback to provide an audit trail.

initiativeNextSteps.title: Next Steps
initiativeNextSteps.description: Immediate actions or plans following the current decision (e.g., build next iteration, pivot hypothesis, schedule pilot). Indicates the path forward.

initiativeBudget.title: Initiative Budget (€)
initiativeBudget.description: Allocated financial resources for this initiative. Include estimates for development, testing, marketing, and other costs.

initiativeResources.title: Resources Needed
initiativeResources.description: List of non-financial resources required (e.g., personnel, equipment, partnerships). Helps ensure the team has what they need for experiments.

initiativeRisks.title: Risks & Mitigation
initiativeRisks.description: Identify potential risks (technical, market, regulatory) that could hinder success, along with mitigation plans or contingency strategies.

initiativeDateRegistered.title: Date Registered
initiativeDateRegistered.description: Date when this initiative was first entered into the system. Supports timeline tracking.

initiativeStartDate.title: Start Date
initiativeStartDate.description: Actual or planned start date of the current initiative phase. Useful for tracking schedule adherence.

initiativeEndDate.title: End Date
initiativeEndDate.description: Actual or planned end date of the current phase or initiative. Critical for post‐mortem analysis and timeline reporting.

initiativeLastUpdated.title: Last Updated
initiativeLastUpdated.description: Automatically updated timestamp for whenever any initiative property changes. Read-only.

initiativeNotes.title: Additional Notes
initiativeNotes.description: Freeform field for any extra comments, context, or links that don’t fit in other structured fields (e.g., links to Figma mockups, research documents).
